projects.title: Blog
projects.description: I want to become a better programmer and writer. A blog is an excellent way to do both. After a few iterations I found it was easier to write while addressing a specific person. Hence the birth of "Hey Heather, it's me again". I write about general things I've been working on and things I don't understand.
projects.tech: jekyll, liquid, ruby, css, javascript, git

projects.title: Projects Page
projects.description: I used a template engine to build this site. My primary concern was being able to add a project in a quick and simple manner. All projects are therefore JSON objects. I also wanted to keep the aesthetic of the site clean and simple so chose to display the projects in a vertical card-like list.
projects.tech: nunjucks, gulp, json, css, node, javascript, git

projects.title: Ghibli API
projects.description: I wanted to play around with APIs. Here I'm using Studio Ghibli's API to get the title and description of movies. Initially this was set up using a XMLHttpRequest. I decided to change it to use the Fetch API.
projects.tech: javascript, studio ghibli api, css, git

projects.title: Be Kind Bot
projects.description: Inspired by a conversation between Shane Parrish and Adam Grant on The Knowledge Project podcast, I decided to write a twitter bot that asked the same question on a daily basis. One issue that came up was that the Twitter API throws an error when a duplicate status is detected. To circumvent the issue, I added the ordinal date as the first part of the tweet. I also created and launched an aws ec2 instance to serve the code.
projects.tech: aws ec2, twitter api, javascript, git

projects.title: Reacting
projects.description: At my previous office, many of the sites we managed were changing to React. I left before the changes happened so decide to try React on my own time.
